title: What are the differences and similarities of modern science and philosophy of science? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the differences and similarities of modern science and philosophy of science? They are categorically different things. Philosophy of science isn’t science - it’s just a bunch of words seeking to explain how science works. Most of these words apply only to physics, and the farther you get from physics, the less meaningful they become. Because you can’t make a good experiment in geography or sociology. Modern science, at least in physics, which I know, tries to work according to the most popular theory of philosophy of science, “scientific method”. The one about making experiments, checking if they work according to theories, adjusting theories and making more experiments to verify new theories.

Science and philosophy of science are two different disciplines. science studies how nature behaves and formulates universal statements called laws. philosophy of science studies how scientists do science and formulate “laws” about the way science is or should be done.
